page.title: 13SADBERGE MEMORIES
page.content: Mrs. Dodds was born in 1902 and went to the old village school.Her teacher was a man called Mr.Davidson and there was only one other teacher.She started school when she was five and stayed there till she was twelve.If she misbehaved she would get the cane across her hands.She might have got the cane for playing tricks,doing bad work or getting her sewing or knitting wrong.She learned a lot of scripture and prayers which she can still remember.She did an hours homework each night.There was a farm right in the middle of the village in those days,now it is a house called Tithe House.They had no cars just horses and carts.At school they played skipping, tops and whips and bowling hoops.I am unhappy because Mrs.Dodds died last week.I used to go messages for her. By Claire Monteith (9 years old)
